snippet: The fate of Syrian refugees in the United States erupts into a battle over states’ rights, even though governors have no power over the federal resettlement program.
abstract: Connecticut Gov Dannel P Malloy personally welcomes Syrian refugee family whose invitation to settle in Indiana was withdrawn; New Jersey Gov Chris Christie sends letter to Obama administration saying state will not welcome Syrian refugees; two differing reactions illustrate divide among nation's governors over issue.
lead_paragraph: The fate of Syrian refugees in the United States erupts into a battle over states’ rights, even though governors have no power over the federal resettlement program.

headline.main: Malloy Welcomes a Syrian Family to Connecticut as Christie Shuns Refugees
headline.print_headline: Malloy Welcomes a Syrian Family to Connecticut as Christie Shuns Refugees
